title: Suicide ruled in death of Las Vegas boy, 8, shot in head
content:
LAS VEGAS (AP) -
Authorities say the death of an 8-year-old Las Vegas boy found last month with a gunshot wound to his head has been ruled a suicide.
Las Vegas Metro police said the incident was reported about 5:30 p.m. on Oct. 10, when a teenager called for help and reported the boy had been shot at his home in the southwestern part of the city.
He was pronounced at the scene with what appeared to be a self-inflicted wound.
On Thursday, the Clark County Coroner's office said Clayton James Singleton died of suicide, one of the youngest cases in the county's history.
Investigators have said the boy lived at the home but there were no adults present at the time of the incident.
The firearm belonged to a member of the household.
